Label: axis
Definition: The property relates a coordinate system to one of its axis
IGN Definition: An axis used by some ellipsoidal or cartesian coordinate system. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 17, association role axis.

Label: base CRS
Definition: The geodetic coordinate reference system on which a projected coordinate reference system is based. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 11, association role baseCRS.
IGN Definition: The geodetic coordinate reference system on which a projected coordinate reference system is based. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 11, association role baseCRS.
The cartesian coordinate system used by some geodetic or projected coordinate reference system. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, tables 10 et 11, association roles coordinateSystem.
The conversion used to define a projected coordinate reference system. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 7, named association Definition.

Label: coordinate system
Definition: The property relates a coordinate reference system to its coordinate system
IGN Definition: The coordinate system used by a coordinate reference system. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 5, named association CoordinateSystem.

Label: cylindrical cs
Definition: Links a coordinate reference system to a cylindrical coordinate system

Label: datum
Definition: The property relates a coordinate reference system to a datum
IGN Definition: The datum used by a single coordinate reference system. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 5, named association DefiningDatum.

ISO Definition: parameter used to define the parametric datum

Label: axisdirection
Definition: The property relates a coordinate system axis to its axis direction

IGN Definition: Geographic area or time interval in which the referring object is valid. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, tables 4, 33 and 42, attribute domainOfValidity.

Label: ellipsoid
Definition: The properties relates a datum to its ellipsoid definition
IGN Definition: The ellipsoid used by a geodetic datum. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 34, association role ellipsoid.
The ellipsoidal coordinate system used by a geodetic coordinate reference system. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 10, named association CoordinateSystem.

ISO Definition: inaccuracy introduced through use of this collection of reference frames or datumsNote: It is an indication of the differences in coordinate values at all points between the various realizations that have been grouped into this datum ensemble.
epoch of coordinates that define a dynamic reference frame

longitude of the prime meridian measured from the internationally-recognised reference meridian ('Greenwich meridian'), positive eastward Note 1: Default value: 0 degrees. Note 2: If the value of the prime meridian name is “Greenwich” then the value of greenwichLongitude is required to be 0 degrees.

IGN Definition: The geodetic datum used by a geodetic coordinate reference system. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 10, named association DefiningDatum.
The geographic bounding box used for defining a domain of validity. Cf. ISO 19115-1:2014:2014-04, part 6.6.1 and table B.15 line 337.
Indicates the longitude from Greenwich meridian. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 35, attribute prime meridian Greenwich longitude.
Indicates the single coordinate reference systems used by a compound coordinate reference system. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 6, association role componentReferenceSystem.
Indicates the inverse flattening value of an ellipsoid, expressed as a number or a ratio (percentage rate, parts per million, etc.). Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 37, attribute inverse flattening
The parameter associated to a given value. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 55, association role parameter.

Label: prime meridian
Definition: The prime meridian used by a geodetic datum. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 34, association role primeMeridian.
IGN Definition: The prime meridian used by a geodetic datum. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 34, association role primeMeridian.

ISO Definition: length of the semi-median axis of a triaxial ellipsoidNote: This parameter is not required for a biaxial ellipsoid.

Label: semi major axis
Definition: Indicates the length of the semi major axis of an ellipsoid. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 36, attribute length of semi-major axis.
IGN Definition: Indicates the length of the semi major axis of an ellipsoid. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 36, attribute length of semi-major axis.
ISO Definition: semi-diameter of the longest axis of an ellipsoid

Label: semi minor axis
Definition: Indicates the length of the semi minor axis of an ellipsoid. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 37, attribute length of semi-minor axis.
IGN Definition: Indicates the length of the semi minor axis of an ellipsoid. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 37, attribute length of semi-minor axis.
ISO Definition: semi-diameter of the shortest axis of an ellipsoid

Label: source CRS
Definition: The coordinate reference system associated to the data used as input of a given operation. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 42, named association Source.
IGN Definition: The coordinate reference system associated to the data used as input of a given operation. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 42, named association Source.

Label: target CRS
Definition: The coordinate reference system associated to the data obtained as output of a given operation. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 42, named association Target.
IGN Definition: The coordinate reference system associated to the data obtained as output of a given operation. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 42, named association Target.
The method used by an operation on coordinates. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 43, association role method.
A parameter used by a method to perform an operation on coordinates. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 48, association role parameter.
A value used by an operation on coordinates. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 43, association role parameterValue.
The vertical coordinate system used by a vertical coordinate reference system. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 14, named association CoordinateSystem.
The vertical datum used by a vertical coordinate reference system. Cf. ISO 19111:2007:2007-07, table 14, named association DefiningDatum.
